intro: Heisteria scandens, commonly known as the climbing heister, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Simaroubaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruits are dry, three-lobed capsules that release seeds when mature. Heisteria scandens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
